gpio_example.c File Reference

Detailed Description

GPIO example application for AVR32 UC3.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices with GPIO.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file gpio_example.c.

#include "compiler.h"
#include "gpio.h"
#include "board.h"

Go to the source code of this file.

Defines

#define GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_1   LED2_GPIO
#define GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_2   LED3_GPIO
#define GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_3   GPIO_PUSH_BUTTON_0

Functions

int main (void)
 This is an example of how to access the GPIO pin, the first part of the main() explains how to access GPIO register. It is also possible to use the GPIO driver gpio.c. The second part of the main uses the gpio.c driver to set and clear the pin GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE.

Function Documentation

int main ( void   ) 

This is an example of how to access the GPIO pin, the first part of the main() explains how to access GPIO register. It is also possible to use the GPIO driver gpio.c. The second part of the main uses the gpio.c driver to set and clear the pin GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE.

References gpio_clr_gpio_pin(), gpio_enable_pin_glitch_filter(), gpio_get_pin_value(), GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_1, GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_2, GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_3, gpio_set_gpio_pin(), and gpio_tgl_gpio_pin().

00099 {
00100   U32 state = 0;
00101   U32 i;
00102 
00103   gpio_enable_pin_glitch_filter(GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_3);
00104   while (1)
00105   {
00106     switch (state)
00107     {
00108     case 0:
00109       // Access with GPIO driver gpio.c with clear and set access.
00110       gpio_clr_gpio_pin(GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_1);
00111       state++;
00112       break;
00113 
00114     case 1:
00115       gpio_set_gpio_pin(GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_1);
00116       state++;
00117       break;
00118 
00119     case 2:
00120       // Note that it is also possible to use the GPIO toggle feature.
00121       gpio_tgl_gpio_pin(GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_1);
00122       state++;
00123       break;
00124 
00125     case 3:
00126     default:
00127       gpio_tgl_gpio_pin(GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_1);
00128       state = 0;
00129       break;
00130     }
00131 
00132     // Poll push button value.
00133     for (i = 0; i < 1000; i += 4)
00134     {
00135       if (gpio_get_pin_value(GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_3) == 0)
00136         gpio_clr_gpio_pin(GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_2);
00137       else
00138         gpio_set_gpio_pin(GPIO_PIN_EXAMPLE_2);
00139     }
00140   }
00141 }
